pt.ptcris.utils

Class ORCIDHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ptcris.utils.ORCIDHelper

  • public class ORCIDHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    An helper to simplify the use of the low-level ORCID client. Provides support for asynchronous communication with ORCID although it is only active for GET requests due to resource limitations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • client

        public final ORCIDClient client
        The client used to communicate with ORCID. Defines the ORCID user profile being managed and the Member API id being user to source works.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllWorkSummaries

        public java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary> getAllWorkSummaries()
                                                                                  throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException
        Retrieves the entire set of work summaries from the set ORCID profile that have at least an external identifier set. Merges each ORCID group into a single summary, following groupToWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.activities.WorkGroup).
        Returns:
        the set of work summaries in the set ORCID profile
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if the communication with ORCID fails

      • getSourcedWorkSummaries

        public java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary> getSourcedWorkSummaries()
                                                                                      throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException
        Retrieves the entire set of work summaries in the ORCID profile whose source is the Member API id defined in the ORCID client.
        Returns:
        the set of work summaries in the ORCID profile for the defined source
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if the communication with ORCID fails

      • getFullWork

        public void getFullWork(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary mergedWork,
                        java.util.Map<java.math.BigInteger,PTCRISyncResult> cb)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Gets a full work from an ORCID profile and adds it to a callback map. The resulting work contains every external identifier set in the input work summary, because the summary resulted from the merging of a group, but the retrieved full work is a single work. It also clears the put-code, since at this level they represent the local identifier. If possible, the process is asynchronous. If the process fails, the exception is embedded in a failed PTCRISyncResult.
        Parameters:
        mergedWork - the work summary representing a merged group
        cb - the callback object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the merged work is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.getWork(WorkSummary)

      • getFullWorks

        public void getFullWorks(java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary> mergedWorks,
                         java.util.Map<java.math.BigInteger,PTCRISyncResult> cb,
                         ProgressHandler handler)
                  throws org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException,
                         java.lang.NullPointerException
        Gets a list of full works from an ORCID profile and adds them to a callback map. The resulting works contain every external identifier set in the input work summaries, because the latter resulted from the merging of a group, but the retrieved full works are a single work. It also clears the put-codes, since at this level they represent the local identifier. If possible, the process is asynchronous. If the list is not a singleton, a bulk request will be performed. If the process fails of for any work, the exceptions are embedded in failed PTCRISyncResult.
        Parameters:
        mergedWorks - the work summaries representing the merged groups
        cb - the callback object
        handler - the progress handler responsible for receiving progress updates
        Throws:
        org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.client.exception.OrcidClientException - if the communication with ORCID fails
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the merged work is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.getWorks(List)

      • addWorks

        public java.util.List<PTCRISyncResult> addWorks(java.util.List<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> localWorks,
                                                ProgressHandler handler)
                                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Synchronously adds a list of works to an ORCID profile, either through atomic or bulk calls. A list of results is returned, one for each input work. The OK result includes the newly assigned put-code. If communication fails, error message is included in the result. If the overall communication fails, the result is replicated for each input.
        Parameters:
        localWorks - the new works to be added
        handler - the progress handler responsible for receiving progress updates
        Returns:
        the results of the ORCID call for each input work
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • updateWork

        public PTCRISyncResult updateWork(java.math.BigInteger remotePutcode,
                                  org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work updatedWork)
                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Synchronously updates a work in an ORCID profile.
        Parameters:
        remotePutcode - the put-code of the remote ORCID work that will be updated
        updatedWork - the new state of the work that will be updated
        Returns:
        the result of the ORCID call
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        See Also:
        ORCIDClient.updateWork(BigInteger, Work)

      • waitWorkers

        public boolean waitWorkers()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for all active asynchronous workers communicating with ORCID to finish (if multi-threading is enabled, otherwise it is always true).
        Returns:
        whether the workers finished before the timeout
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the process was interrupted

      • getSelfExternalIdsDiff

        public static java.util.Map<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work,ExternalIdsDiff> getSelfExternalIdsDiff(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work,
                                                                                                           java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> works)
                                                                                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Calculates the symmetric difference of self external identifiers between a work summary and a set of works. Works that do not match (i.e., no identifier is common) are ignored.
        Parameters:
        work - the work summary to be compared with other works
        works - the set of works against which the work summary is compared
        Returns:
        The symmetric difference of self external identifiers between work and works
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the parameters is null

      • getSelfExternalIdsDiff

        public static java.util.Map<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work,ExternalIdsDiff> getSelfExternalIdsDiff(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work,
                                                                                                           java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> works)
                                                                                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        works - the set of works against which the work summary is compared

      • hasNewSelfIDs

        public static boolean hasNewSelfIDs(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                                    org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, i.e., whether a work has the same self external identifiers as another one. This test is expected to be used by the import algorithms, where only new self external identifiers are to be considered.
        Parameters:
        preWork - The potentially out of date work
        posWork - The up to date work
        Returns:
        true if all the self external identifiers between the two works are the same, false otherwise

      • isUpToDate

        public static boolean isUpToDate(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                                 org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, considering the external identifiers and additional meta-data. This test is expected to be used by the export algorithms, where the meta-data is expected to be up-to-date on the remote profile.
        Parameters:
        preWork - the potentially out of date work
        posWork - the up to date work
        Returns:
        true if all the external identifiers and the meta-data between the two works are the same, false otherwise

      • isUpToDate

        public static boolean isUpToDate(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work preWork,
                                 org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work posWork)
        Checks whether a work is already up to date regarding another one, considering the external identifiers and additional meta-data.
        Parameters:
        preWork - the potentially out of date work
        posWork - the up to date work
        Returns:
        true if all the external identifiers and the meta-data between the two works are the same, false otherwise

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data, returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All this meta-data is available in work summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null
        See Also:
        testMinimalQuality(Work, Collection)

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work,
                                                                 java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> others)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data and that of coexisting works, and returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. The test also checks whether the external identifiers overlap with those of the coexisting works. All this meta-data is available in work summaries. The publication date is not necessary for data sets and research techniques. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        others - other coexisting works
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work summary has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data, returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. All this meta-data is available in work summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work summary to test for quality
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null
        See Also:
        testMinimalQuality(WorkSummary, Collection)

      • testMinimalQuality

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> testMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work,
                                                                 java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> others)
                                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Tests whether a work summary has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data and that of coexisting works, and returns the detected invalid fields. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. The test also checks whether the external identifiers overlap with those of the coexisting works. All this meta-data is available in work summaries. The publication date is not necessary for data sets and research techniques. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        others - other coexisting works
        Returns:
        the set of invalid fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • tryMinimalQuality

        public static void tryMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work,
                                     java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> others)
                              throws InvalidWorkException
        Tests whether a work has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data. Throws an exception if the test fails. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. The overlapping of external identifiers with other works is also tested. All this meta-data is available in work summaries. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the work to test for quality
        others - other coexisting works
        Throws:
        InvalidWorkException - if the quality test fails, containing the reasons for failing
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • tryMinimalQuality

        public static void tryMinimalQuality(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.WorkSummary work,
                                     java.util.Collection<org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work> others)
                              throws InvalidWorkException
        Tests whether a work summary has minimal quality to be synchronized, by inspecting its meta-data. Throws an exception if the test fails. The considered fields are: self external identifiers, title, publication date (year), work type. The overlapping of external identifiers with other works is also tested. All this meta-data is available in work summaries. TODO: contributors are not being considered as they are not contained in the summaries.
        Parameters:
        work - the summary work to test for quality
        others - other coexisting works
        Throws:
        InvalidWorkException - if the quality test fails, containing the reasons for failing
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the work is null

      • getNonNullExternalIds

        public static org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.common.ExternalIds getNonNullExternalIds(org.um.dsi.gavea.orcid.model.work.Work work)
